Key Match Events: LeBron James scored 16 of the Lakers' 21 points to start the fourth quarter, including 11 straight points.
Domantas Sabonis recorded a triple-double with 29 points, 12 rebounds, and 10 assists.
LeBron James recorded a triple-double with 32 points, 14 rebounds, and 10 assists.
Anthony Davis had a standout performance with 31 points, 9 rebounds, 3 steals, 2 assists, and 2 blocks.
Post-Match Reflections: Mike Brown spoke after the Minnesota game about not having figured out his rotation, and he clearly still hasn't.
The Kings' front office has failed to address known issues, particularly the lack of size to match bigger teams.
The Kings' rotation remains tight, with key players logging heavy minutes.
The coach highlighted the need for better defensive strategies and adjustments.
